conclusion: Need to find the speed of the block from A to B and the ratio of supporting force to gravitational force at B.
Smooth circular track with radius 0.8m; Point A is on the same horizontal line as center O; Point B is directly below center O; Point C is 0.2m above point B.
Block slides from A to B and enters a horizontal conveyor belt moving to the right.
Track is smooth, so mechanical energy is conserved from A to B.
Use conservation of energy to find speed at point B.
Potential energy at A equals kinetic energy at B plus potential energy at B.
Point A is at the same height as center O; height of A above lowest point is radius.
Height of A above B is 0.8m.
Solve for v_B: v_B = sqrt(16) = 4 m/s.
Speed of block at point B is 4 m/s.
Find ratio of supporting force to gravitational force at point B.
At point B, block is moving horizontally, no radial acceleration.
Forces at point B: weight mg downward, normal force FN upward.
Net force in vertical direction is zero: FN - mg = 0.
Supporting force FN equals gravitational force mg.
